intro: Myosotis subvillosa, commonly known as the hairy forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Myosotis subvillosa is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance.
